summary: The text discusses the prophecy of the angel predicting the events following the crucifixion of Christ, including the destruction of the city and temple by the Romans under the leadership of Vespasian. It describes the Roman army's conquest and retribution against the Jews for their role in the death of Christ, emphasizing that these events fulfilled scriptural prophecy. The passage questions the significance of these events if Christ had not yet come and alludes to the current desolate state of Zion and Jewish dispersion as evidence of these prophetic outcomes.
